page.title: 01Introduction to the Area
page.content:
The survey rectangle is 6 miles to the North of Norwich and 12 miles from the Norfolk coast.
It is predominately an agricultural area where large arable fields often surrounded by hedges, are occasionally interrupted by small patches of woodland.
The terrain is gently undulating but slopes fairly steeply to the NE to the valley bottom of the River Bure. The river valley is a major influence on the siting of roads, railways (now closed) and the twin villages of Horstead and Coltishall. These villages are the centres of population in the survey rectangle. Elsewhere isolated hamlets and houses exist.
